subject: Productivity
title: Henry Ford and the Assembly Line
description: One-minute skill: Henry Ford and the Assembly Line.

hook.text: Before Ford, building a car took twelve hours per vehicle. After the assembly line: 93 minutes.

buildup.text: Ford didn't invent the assembly line. He perfected it by combining division of labor with moving belts.

discovery.text: Each worker repeated one small task. Time per unit plummeted and the Model T became affordable.

twist.text: Ford also introduced the eight-hour workday. Rested workers were faster than exhausted ones.

climax.text: The assembly line model spread worldwide and defined manufacturing for the next century.

punchline.text: Ford proved that less work time could mean more output.

quiz.question: What did Henry Ford introduce alongside the assembly line?
